title: Make public GHRepository.getOwnerName
Add information about thread-safety in Javadoc
body:
Especially, it is interesting to know:
Is it possible to use `GitHub` instance in the few concurrent threads?

title: Add API to retrieve list of contributors
fix #145 GHTeam.getMembers() does not page properly
body: GHTeam.getMembers() would only return the first 30 members of an organization.  This fixes that by reading each page of results.

title: GHTeam.getMembers() response does not include all users if user count >30
body:
I have not gotten to the bottom of why this is happening, but getMembers() returns at most 30 members, even if the team has more.

I have a strong suspicion that the API is returning paged results but the response processing is not fetching the pages.

Will submit a PR if I can get it fixed.

title: Parsing a push event payload doesn't get the repository
body: The `GHEventPayload.Push` class does not contain a way to get the `GHRepository` that was pushed to despite the [GitHub API sending it](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/types/#pushevent).

title: Complete api implementation for the new github deployment api
body: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/deployments/#create-a-deployment

title: Add code for creating deployments for a repo
Trivial change to enable creating/updating binary content (files).
body:
I need to use git as a file server for all kinds of files, including binary ones.  This Java library is very nice but it's missing the ability to create or update binary files.  Adding support for it was a trivial change that I would appreciate if you can merge ASAP. 

Thanks!
Alvaro

title: Update mockito-all to test scope
body:
Set scope to test for mockito-all to avoid forcing downstream projects
to include it.

title: Put mockito in the test scope.
body: I was having issues in a downstream project from github-api where mockito was appearing on the classpath where it shouldn't. I ran some dependency analysis and found that the inclusion was because of its mention in github-api without the test scope designation.

title: GHRelease issue
added 'diverged' constant to GHCompare.Status enum
body:
Hi, I was using using your project and I found this small issue.

Simone Carriero

title: Add paging support for Team's Repositories
body: The team repositories endpoint does do paging, so gotta support that.

title: 502 Bad Gateway error from GHRelease.uploadAsset
body:
I'm using https://github.com/jutzig/github-release-plugin which is built on this library. Today I started getting this error anytime I try to make a release: ``` [INFO] [ERROR] 502 Bad Gateway [INFO] [ERROR] [INFO] [ERROR]

Bad Gateway

[INFO] [ERROR]

The proxy server received an invalid [INFO] [ERROR] response from an upstream server.
[INFO] [ERROR]

[INFO] [ERROR] : Server returned HTTP response code: 502 for URL: https://uploads.github.com/repos/......... ``` Might be related to http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21698009/github-api-502-error

title: GHRepository.getIssues(GHIssueState.CLOSED) also return pull requests
body:
Hi kohsuke,

I was using your api, it was great but there is this bug I hope you can fix it soon:
Whenever I call the function GHRepository.getIssues(GHIssueState.CLOSED), it returns a list of both issues and pull requests. 

I expect only issue though. Currently my work around is to call getPullRequests then for each issue from getIssues, I search in the whole list of pull requests to see if it is already there. Then I ignore it. But this makes my algorithm runs at O(n*m). 

Please fix it soon.

title: [INFRA-142] - Introduce a method, which utilizes "add group membership" API call
body:
This API call allows to invite users to an organization on demand

Signed-off-by: Oleg Nenashev o.v.nenashev@gmail.com

title: Add GHCompare.getFiles() method to be able to see the precise files chan...
body:
...ged.

There is a file field inside of GHCompare but no getter to extract the values
for analysis.

There are contents in that field so I've added a new get method so that they
can be extracted.

title: Modify GitHubBuilder to resolve user credentials from the system environ...
body:
...ment

Using the Jenkins EnvInject or Credentials Binding Plugins its possible to
pass credentials as Environment Variables.

Its useful for Github.connect() to be able to directly read the values of the
login, password and oauth properties from the environment.

This commit modifies the base Github.connect() method to resolve credentials
in two steps:
1. ~/.github credentials file if it exists.
2. login, password or oauth variables from the environment

A further fromEnvironment() method is provided to support
loading from non-standard variable names.

The old Github.connect() method would throw an IOException if the ~/.github file
did not exist.  Now it will fail silently instead dropping back to the anonymous
users access level.

Thanks in advance!

- retrieves all users and all organisations by using the [/users api](https://developer.github.com//v3/users/#get-all-users) call.вЂЁthe resulting GHPerson list is available as well as the GHUser and GHOrganization list. call is used for GH enterprise integration into existing enterprise infrastructure.

title: retrieve allUsers, allOrganizations with single API call
body:
retrieves all users and all organisations by using the [/users api call](https://developer.github.com/v3/users/#get-all-users).
the resulting GHPerson list is available as well as the GHUser and GHOrganization list. call is used for GH enterprise integration into existing enterprise infrastructure.

title: Allow to use custom HttpConnector when only OAuth token is given
body:
The old pull request is #120.

If you use `GitHub.connectUsingOAuth(String oauthAccessToken)` or `GitHub.connectUsingOAuth(String githubServer, String oauthAccessToken)`, the constructor of `GitHub` calls `#getMyself`.
Because there is no way to call `#setConnector` before the construction, `#getMyself` will fail if the server is behind proxies.
This pull request allows library users to use custom HttpConnector when only OAuth token is given.

Example usage is:

``` java
GitHub gh = new GitHubBuilder()
    .withEndpoint(serverAPIUrl)
    .withOAuthToken(accessToken)
    .withConnector(new HttpConnectorWithJenkinsProxy())
    .build();
```

title: Use issues endpoints for pull requests
body:
Setting labels and assignee on Pull requests failed silently, because the API endpoint being hit contained '/pulls/' rather than '/issues/'.

> "Every pull request is an issue, but not every issue is a pull request. For this reason, вЂњsharedвЂќ actions for both features, like manipulating assignees, labels and milestones, are provided within the Issues API."

https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#labels-assignees-and-milestones
